com.mapgroup.classificator.controller

Class ConnectionCloserExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapgroup.classificator.controller.ConnectionCloserExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IServerExecutor

    public class ConnectionCloserExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
implements IServerExecutor
    This class provides a way in order to ask to the server to close the connection

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConnectionCloserExecutor() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ServerResponse executeCommand(ContextRequest contextRequest)
      Sending a specific context structure which contains the current context information, asks to the server to close the current connection with the specified host and prints all the result of the operation on a specific panel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionCloserExecutor

        public ConnectionCloserExecutor()

    • Method Detail

      • executeCommand

        public ServerResponse executeCommand(ContextRequest contextRequest)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Sending a specific context structure which contains the current context information, asks to the server to close the current connection with the specified host and prints all the result of the operation on a specific panel.

        The context request structure must have these specific parameters in the order:

        • null
        • null
        • the panel in which are listed all the connected clients
        • the model associated to the panel
        • client's ip address
        Specified by:
        executeCommand in interface IServerExecutor
        Parameters:
        contextRequest - information about the context in which the computation will be done
        Returns:
        Server response with a specific message that is printed when the operation is completed
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - if some errors in closing the connection occurred
